content.description: Start crouched with feet on a pedestal at ground level, left hand on a good crimp, and right hand pressed up into the mini roof feature. Move up and left on slopers, crimps, and juggy features near the top.
content.location: Just to the right of Dwarf’s Downfall on that same formation. Look for the incut roof feature with white rock. You’ll pass this route while walking from the Deep to Dwarf’s Downfall.

content.description: Short, stout boulder that leaves the dwarven-built type at a disadvantage. Sit-start on the two low jugs. Use core and foot work to get yourself to the first sloped bulge that contains a surprisingly good crimp. Then use your height (if you have it) and arm strength to launch a throw up and left to the very good slopey looking jug. From here, climb easy terrain up to the top-out and scramble down climbers right to descend.
content.location: Find The Deep boulder and keep walking past it to the South West. About 100ft away you will see a band of rock. At the very west end of this band you will find a corner with several sloped bulges and a thin crack on climbers left of the slopey bulges.

content.description: Start on the lowest part of the steep prow with good hands on either side and feet where you can find them. Work out the compression beta as you fight your way up through great edges and heel hooks to exit at the boulder’s high point. This climb is sure to be a classic once it sees some more traffic
content.location: You will know it when you see it.

content.description: Contains a few good boulders right next to each other. This area is near a sub summit with great views and gets sun all day in the winter. The Deep boulder is a diamond in the rough, waiting for you to come climb it. The Dwarf’s Downfall boulder is a great warmup option before jumping on the Deep.
